I think itâ€™s safe to say to add all the OG packs back like legacy, minecon, and birthday skin packs so players will have the chance to get them again
One time purchase?  Maybe...  2 euros per custom cape...  No.  I think it should be free, or they should at least give use the option of importing our own designs.
Maybe we could use Banners? And combine them on a Crafting Table like Shields?
I love this idea. I would say they could add a few to the achievements but I don't know how well it wouldwork with pre-exsisting accounts with all the achievements unlocked.
Love it i am voting

I agree, it should not be linked to achevements because some people have already gotten them all, but, maybe, you could earn them by doing things such as completing raids, mining netherrite, killing enderdragons/withers, this would only be available in games with no cheats

This. It'd also make me, someone without it, have a more unique skin, too, since my whole entire MC identity's based off of the missing texture, it's hard for me not to look at my eyes and see that they don't match the chequerboard pattern of a grid of missing textures.
I was struggling to do that with my character too! I also love the idea of adding headscarf to the game
I would love this! I have the condition (Iridium one) too and it would be very fun to see other people with it and have myself represented in my (Minecraft) skin!
This! I don't have the condition, but I do really want to be able to customise my avatar just a bit more!
In the nightmare before christmas pack (ithink) theres a character in a wheelchair so it is possible

I have MS and spend a lot of time playing Minecraft. I would like to have a skin option that appears like a wheelchair too, just because I identify that way.

After reading the original poster's comments about teaching others to be comfortable interacting with people in wheelchairs, I think that is a great idea. Just one more thing to enhance the diversity and inclusion of players with disabilities.
I'm trying to make an accurate Zombie skin, and this would really help me, also, please make this for the other functions (e.g. beards and mouths)
Had this idea, icecream should be crafted with a snowball and bucket of milk and cocoa beans
Yes to the icecream, maybe not the dougnuts
How would you craft the donuts? I was thinking maybe you could do wheat, sugar, and eggs.
Or maybe they should just remove in-game purchases altogether. They wouldn't be here if it weren't for greedy micro$soft getting involved.

"Coins" or "gems" are a predatory system in microtransactions that obscure how much money the user is really spending and force people to pay more than they want to if they're buying a single, low-cost item.

There have been times where I have wanted to spend a very specific $0.99. I have and will continue to want to buy things that cost $0.99 from games I enjoy. Sadly, the majority of games don't allow a purchase of only $0.99, so I switch to a different game and spend my money there. Less purchase options means less revenue.
I don't have coin
This should happen. Although, the larger companies are, the dumber they get but I guess we will see.

I agree with this. There are ones I got both for free and with Minecoins that I simply don't want. Not to mention it takes forever to scroll bc the Marketplace is slow and a bit laggy at times. It takes longer than it should to find the skin packs I want to get to because I can't get rid of the ones I hate having now.
I don't even understand why there isn't already a system to delete unwanted skin packs from your account. Even if they just added an option to hide the ones you don't use anymore, I don't care, I'm just sick of seeing them.

I agree 100%. I have terribly outdated packs that I no longer use or want,and I cannot delete them. I'm surprised this is only has 8 votes because having to keep unwanted marketplace packs makes no sense whatsover.

Ok you all may have a valid point but Minecraft furniture isnâ€™t a bad idea like when you build a nice house and want more decoration in the house like maybe a tv or a actual couch and tables and chairs maybe even lamps or something along those lines and all these things could be added to the base game with simple crafting options like for example a couch would the 4 wool and 2 planks and 4 sticks ect. For the rest even a tv that was just for looks that would be crafted with redstone and iron. Thatâ€™s all I have to say I hope Mojang gets the idea and made this happen for it would add a lot more than what people thing.
No. Furniture would ruin the creativity part of minecraft (people making their own furniture out of existing items.)
One Problem with creating furniture in minecraft is that there's no right clicking stairs to sit in them, and having a minecart pushed into a staircase loses the aesthetic look.
